claim: A traffic collision can make someone a millionaire.

supporting.text: A severe traffic collision may result in a large legal settlement or court-awarded compensation, exceeding one million dollars.

attacks.text: A severe traffic collision may result in a large legal settlement or court-awarded compensation, exceeding one million dollars.
Most traffic collisions result in minor injuries or property damage, with settlements far below one million dollars.
Even severe collisions often involve lengthy legal battles, with no guarantee of a favorable or high-value settlement.
Insurance policies often have caps on payouts, preventing settlements from reaching one million dollars.
Some jurisdictions have no-fault insurance laws, limiting the ability to sue for large settlements.
Legal fees and medical expenses can consume a significant portion of any settlement, reducing net compensation.

supporting.text: Insurance payouts for permanent disability or loss of income due to a collision can accumulate to over one million dollars.

attacks.text: Insurance payouts for permanent disability or loss of income due to a collision can accumulate to over one million dollars.
Most insurance policies have payout caps that prevent total compensation from reaching one million dollars.
High-profile cases or lawsuits can result in settlements exceeding policy limits, potentially surpassing one million dollars.
The legal process to secure large payouts is lengthy, costly, and uncertain, making million-dollar outcomes rare.
In cases of severe disability, structured settlements or annuities can provide lifetime payments exceeding one million dollars in total value.

supporting.text: Victims of high-profile collisions involving wealthy or corporate defendants may receive multi-million-dollar settlements.

attacks.text: Victims of high-profile collisions involving wealthy or corporate defendants may receive multi-million-dollar settlements.
Most traffic collisions result in minimal or no financial compensation for victims, especially in cases without clear liability or significant injuries.
Multi-million-dollar settlements are extremely rare and typically require extensive litigation, which most victims cannot afford or endure.
Even in high-profile cases, settlements are often capped by insurance policies, preventing truly life-changing payouts.
Proving negligence or liability in court is difficult, and many cases settle for far less than the potential maximum.
Some jurisdictions have laws that limit damages in personal injury cases, further reducing the likelihood of million-dollar payouts.

supporting.text: Structured settlements from collision lawsuits can provide lifetime payments totaling more than one million dollars.

attacks.text: Structured settlements from collision lawsuits can provide lifetime payments totaling more than one million dollars.
Most traffic collision lawsuits do not result in settlements exceeding one million dollars.
Severe or catastrophic injuries from collisions are more likely to result in million-dollar settlements, though they are rare.
Structured settlements often spread payments over decades, reducing their present value below one million dollars.
Inflation and investment returns can make the long-term value of structured settlements exceed one million dollars in real terms.

supporting.text: Some jurisdictions allow punitive damages in collision cases, which can significantly increase the total award beyond one million dollars.

attacks.text: Some jurisdictions allow punitive damages in collision cases, which can significantly increase the total award beyond one million dollars.
Punitive damages are rare and typically require egregious misconduct, such as drunk driving or intentional harm, which are not present in most traffic collisions.
Even in cases of egregious misconduct, juries are often reluctant to award punitive damages, and judges may reduce or overturn such awards.
The legal process for obtaining punitive damages is lengthy and costly, with no guarantee of success, making it an unreliable path to becoming a millionaire.
Many jurisdictions cap punitive damages, limiting the potential award to well below one million dollars.
Most traffic collisions result in minor injuries or property damage, with settlements or awards far below one million dollars.

supporting.text: Collisions involving commercial vehicles or rideshare services often result in higher compensation due to corporate liability policies.

attacks.text: Collisions involving commercial vehicles or rideshare services often result in higher compensation due to corporate liability policies.
Most commercial vehicle collisions do not result in million-dollar payouts, as settlements are typically capped or negotiated based on actual damages.
High-profile cases involving severe injuries or fatalities from commercial vehicle collisions have resulted in multi-million-dollar settlements, supporting the original claim.
Corporate liability policies often include clauses that limit payouts to avoid excessive financial exposure, reducing the likelihood of million-dollar compensations.
In jurisdictions with strong consumer protection laws, courts may override corporate liability caps, enabling higher compensations.
